Always returns false if the app hasn't been initialized yet."},"curateIssues(address[],uint256[],uint256[],string,string,uint256[],uint256[],uint256)":{"details":"curateIssues(): This function conforms to the upcoming                     specId 2 forwarder interface                     and it is meant to be forwarded to a dot                     voting app instance or another voting app                     that utilizes dynamic forwarding.                     The unused parameters are in place to conform                     to the above specification.","params":{"_description":"The description of the issue curation"}},"fulfillBounty(address,uint256,address[],string)":{"details":"This is a noop function implemented so the client can display the radspec     for this external contract call. attributes.name: _addBounty
_removeBounty
getHash

params._description: parsed and display to user when this function is forwarded
params._repoIds: The ids of the repos in the projects registry
params._tokenTypes: An array of currency types: 0=ETH from user's wallet, 1=ETH from vault, 20=ERC20 token from vault

params._description: parsed and display to user when this function is forwarded
params._repoIds: The ids of the repos in the projects registry

allowRecoverability(address).details: By default deriving from AragonApp makes it recoverable

params.token: Token address that would be recovered

allowRecoverability(address).return: bool whether the app allows the recovery

canPerform(address,bytes32,uint256[]).details: Check whether an action can be performed by a sender for a particular role on this app
canPerform(address,bytes32,uint256[]).return: Boolean indicating whether the sender has the permissions to perform the action.        Always returns false if the app hasn't been initialized yet.

curateIssues(address[],uint256[],uint256.details: curateIssues(): This function conforms to the upcoming                     specId 2 forwarder interface                     and it is meant to be forwarded to a dot                     voting app instance or another voting app                     that utilizes dynamic forwarding.                     The unused parameters are in place to conform                     to the above specification.

params._description: The description of the issue curation

fulfillBounty(address,uint256,address[],.details: This is a noop function implemented so the client can display the radspec     for this external contract call. It should never execute because it serves no     functional purpose here.

params._fulfillers: array of users who contributed to the fulfillment of the bounty
params._sender: address of the user submitting the fulfillment

params._idx: The applicant's position in the array
params._repoId: The repo id of the issue
the repo id of the issue

getApplicantsLength(bytes32,uint256).return: array length of the applicants array

getInitializationBlock().return: Block number in which the contract was initialized

params._issueNumber: The issue number used to uniquely identify the issue within the repo
params._repoId: The id of the repo in the projects registry

getRecoveryVault().details: Get the recovery vault for the app
getRecoveryVault().return: Recovery vault address for the app

params._repoId: The id of the repo in the projects registry

getRepo(bytes32).return: index: The index value of the repoopenIssueCount: number of currently open issuesdecoupled: whether or not the repo is linked to an external repositoryrepoData: ipfs hash containing information about the repo

hasInitialized().return: Whether the contract has been initialized by the time of the current block

initialize(address,address).details: Initializes the Projects app, this is the Aragon custom constructor

params._bountiesAddr: Address of the StandardBounties deployed instance Projects will rely on (changeable)
params._vault: Address of the vault Projects will rely on (non changeable)

params._description: Utilized when forwarded to give background to the                    issues up for removal
params._repoIds: The ids of the repos in the projects registry

params._repoId: The id of the repo in the projects registry

params._application: IPFS hash for the applicant's proposed timeline and strategy
params._repoId: the repo id of the issue
the repo id of the issue
params._requestor: address of user that will be assigned the issue
params._updatedApplication: IPFS hash of the application containing optional feedback

reviewSubmission(bytes32,uint256,uint256.details: add a submission to local state after it's been added to StandardBounties.sol

params._repoId: the repo id of the issue
params._submissionNumber: submission index of the submitted work for review
params._updatedSubmissionHash: IPFS hash of the submission containing optional feedback

params._issueNumber: the number uniquely identifying the issue within the repo
params._repoId: The id of the repo in the projects registry

params._decoupled: Whether or not the repo is decoupled from a centralized repository
params._repoId: The id of the repo in the projects registry

params._token: Token balance to be sent to recovery vault.

params._data: Information hash stored in the bounty
params._description: Utilized when forwarded to give background to the                    issues up for removal
params._issueNumber: issue number the bounty is assigned to
params._repoId: The id of the repos in the projects registry

changeBountySettings(uint256[],bytes32[].notice: Update settings for the Projects app

fulfillBounty(address,uint256,address[],.notice: Submit a fulfillment for bounty #`_bountyId` with the following info: `_data`

getIssue(bytes32,uint256).notice: Get issue data from the registry.

getRepo(bytes32).notice: Get an entry from the registry.

initialize(address,address).notice: Initialize Projects app for StandardBounties at `_bountiesAddr`

isRepoAdded(bytes32).notice: Checks if a repo exists in the registry

requestAssignment(bytes32,uint256,string.notice: Submit application for issue `_issueNumber` with application `_application`

transferToVault(address).notice: Send funds to recovery Vault. This contract should never receive funds,        but in case it does, this function allows one to recover them.
